bill_title: allow the delivery of malt beverages by an off-sale licensee under certain circumstances.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the delivery of malt beverages by an off-sale licensee under certain circumstances. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 35-4-74 be amended to read as follows: 35-4-74. No off-sale licensee shall may make any delivery of alcoholic beverages outside of the premises described in his the license. However, a licensee licensed pursuant to subdivision 35-4-2(17) may deliver malt beverages if the following requirements are met: (1) The delivery is made to a person who is at least twenty-one years of age and not obviously intoxicated at the time; and (2) The delivery of the malt beverages is in conjunction with the delivery of other products and the cost of the malt beverages delivered does not constitute more than twenty-five percent of the total cost of all the products delivered. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
